title: Prue Leith remembers Twitter gaffe before Great British Bake Off final
text:
Prue Leith paid tribute to her own Twitter gaffe last night (Picture: Mark Bourdillon)

Prue Leith had a little bit of fun last night, as she mocked her infamous Twitter gaffe ahead of last night’s Great British Bake Off final.

The judge wished the three finalists – David Atherton, Alice Fevronia and Steph Blackwell – good luck, before referencing her infamous 2017 slip-up.

Two years ago, of course, Prue accidentally let slip who the winner of the eighth series of the baking hit 11 whole hours before the finale aired.

How could I ever forget??!!!!!😲Good luck to all the finalists tonight…..I am stepping away from my phone!! #GBBOFinal https://t.co/U5IKthjYg3 — Prue Leith (@PrueLeith) October 29, 2019

The Bake Off official twitter account seemed to have a lot of fun with the memory – reminding everyone that yesterday was the annual Don’t Look at Prue’s Twitter Feed Day. The judge seemed to take it all in her stride, though.

‘Good luck to all the finalists tonight,’ the baking icon wrote. ‘I am stepping away from my phone!!’

Well, at least she can laugh at herself.

David was the surprise winner of Bake Off’s tenth series (Picture: Channel 4)

Last night David was crowned as the winner of the tenth series of Bake Off. The nurse’s victory came as something of a surprise, however, given that he had never won Star Baker.

Runner-up Steph Blackwell had previously won Star Baker for a record number of consecutive weeks, so her victory seemed almost assured.

There was a backlash against his win, and David has finally broken his silence after fans accused Steph of being ‘robbed.’

The Great British Bake Off will return in 2020.
